title: Man-Made Marvels (Tell Me Why #112)(gnv64)
description:
Man-Made Marvels (Tell Me Why #112)
By Manorama
English | January 2016 | PDF | 98 pages | 17.9 mb
scanned to PDF by me.

When Stones tell the story ...
The leaning tower of Pisa is famous, not only for its tilt but also for the story that connects it to Galileo Galilei, the legendary scientist. Its builders definitely did not intend the tower to lean, and they must have got a shock when the rising structure started to tilt. Yet, as it turned out, it was this defect that made the tower of Pisa a renowned monument.
The story is different for the Capital Gate in Abu Dhabi, which was originally designed to be inclined, and to look like a replica of the leaning tower of Pisa. The world has many such structures, which make an impression with their size, beauty, historic significance, or all of them combined.
This issue of Tell Me Why will tell you the tales behind some such mesmerising buildings.
 
http://s12.postimg.org/4g4jszrod/Man_Made_Marvels_Tell_Me_Why_112.jpg
